title: The Rainbow Warrior (film)
text:
The Rainbow Warrior (sometimes called The Sinking of the Rainbow Warrior) is a 1993 <a href="television%20film">made-for-television</a> <a href="drama%20%28film%20and%20television%29">drama film</a> directed by <a href="Michael%20Tuchner">Michael Tuchner</a> and starring <a href="Jon%20Voight">Jon Voight</a> and <a href="Sam%20Neill">Sam Neill</a>.
Plot summary.
The film is based on the true story of the <a href="Greenpeace">Greenpeace</a> ship <a href="Rainbow%20Warrior%20%281955%29">"Rainbow Warrior"</a>, which was sunk in <a href="Waitemat%C4%81%20Harbour">Waitematā Harbour</a> in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, New Zealand on 10 July 1985 by French <a href="Directorate-General%20for%20External%20Security">DGSE</a> operatives, when it was preparing for a Pacific voyage to protest against <a href="French%20nuclear%20testing">French nuclear testing</a>. The film chronicles the police investigation to discover what happened to the ship and who was responsible.
